column1: Kodinsk (Russian: Коди́нск) is a town and the administrative center of Kezhemsky District of Krasnoyarsk Krai
column4: 735 kilometers (457 mi) north of Krasnoyarsk. Population: 14

column1: It was founded in 1977 as the settlement of Kodinskoye (Коди́нское) servicing the construction of the Boguchanskaya hydroelectric power station; the name is after the Koda River
column2: a tributary of the Angara that ends about 12 km northeast of the town. The name Koda in turn is derived from Evenki word kada
column3: meaning "cliff". It was granted urban-type settlement status in 1978 and town status in 1989.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: Kodinsk serves as the administrative center of Kezhemsky District. As an administrative division
column4: together with the village of Syromolotovo
column5: incorporated within Kezhemsky District as the district town of Kodinsk. As a municipal division
column6: the district town of Kodinsk is incorporated within Kezhemsky Municipal District as Kodinsk Urban Settlement.
